P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

GENREAL: Output your general reasoning and thought process.  Here you can be as detailed as you want mentioning the reasoning of your predictions as well as how / why each prediction obeys the given consistency rules.  For each prediction you are welcome to be as verbose as you want. If there are multiple questions P, Q, you can also make comments on their independence or relationship with each other.

PROB: Output your probability estimates of each of the variables (P, Q, not_P etc).  Here, ONLY output the labels and its associated predictions and NOTHING ELSE. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    P: 0.xx
    not_P: 0.xx
    P_or_Q: 0.xx
    ...

CHECK: Go through each rule in CONSISTENCY RULES and check whether each rule is obeyed with your given predictions.  For each rule, first print out the mathematical rule and the associated numbers associated with it.  Then think VERY carefully about whether the outputs obey the mathematical rule. Then output whether it obeys the rule. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    neg: P = 1- not_P, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    and:  max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), EQUATION is EVALUATION
    ...
    {ALL consistency checks passed!} OR {failed_check_1, failed_check_2 ... consistency checks failed!}

PROB: Now again output your probability estimates of each variable in a dict like format like before, but taking account and correcting any consistency violations that occured before.
        Note that changing the probability of one given variable for one consistency check will also affect consistency rules for others.  It is IMPERATIVE that all changes  
        your correction needs to ENSURE that it still passes other consistency checks too.
        If there were no violations found then simply output the same dict again.  Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
        P: 0.xx
        not_P: 0.xx
        P_or_Q: 0.xx
        ...
FLOAT: Now just output your probability estimate of P and nothing else as a decimal!

For the new set of questions regarding the potential Republican nominee from the Trump family and the possibility of armed conflicts leading to deaths, I will analyze each component carefully, considering their interdependencies and the consistency rules provided.

### Probability Predictions:
1. **P**: This represents the probability that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Given the prominence of Donald Trump and the possibility of other family members entering the race, I would estimate this probability at around 0.60.

2. **not_P**: This is the complementary probability that no member of the Trump family will be the nominee. Since I estimate P at 0.60, not_P would logically be 0.40.

3. **para_P**: This question is similar to P, asking if it is possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination. Since the events are essentially the same, I would assign para_P the same probability as P, which is 0.60.

4. **Q**: This probability reflects the chance that armed conflicts between the US and China will lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050. Given current geopolitical tensions, I would estimate this at 0.30.

5. **P_and_Q**: This question combines P and Q, requiring both events to occur. Assuming P is 0.60 and Q is 0.30, I can estimate P_and_Q using the product of probabilities, which would be around 0.18 (0.60 * 0.30).

6. **P_or_Q**: This probability covers the scenario where either P or Q occurs. Using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q, I estimate this at 0.60 + 0.30 - 0.18 = 0.72.

7. **Q_and_not_P**: This question requires Q to be true while not_P is true. Assuming Q is 0.30 and not_P is 0.40, I estimate this at 0.12 (0.30 * 0.40).

8. **Q_given_P**: This conditional probability asks if Q occurs given that P is true. Given that P is 0.60 and Q is 0.30, I estimate this at around 0.50, reflecting that if a Trump family member is the nominee, it does not significantly change the likelihood of armed conflict leading to deaths.

### Consistency with Rules:
- **Neg**: P + not_P should equal 1. The estimates meet this rule.
- **Andor**: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q should hold true. I will verify this with calculations.
- **And**: The relationship between P and Q must be checked to ensure it aligns with the maximum and minimum constraints.
- **Or**: The maximum of P and Q must be less than or equal to P_or_Q and should not exceed the sum of P and Q.
- **But**: This rule will be checked as well, ensuring that the relationship holds true.
- **Cond**: This will be validated based on the conditional probabilities.
- **Para**: Lastly, para_P should equal P.

Overall, I will ensure that my estimates adhere to these consistency rules, adjusting as necessary to maintain logical coherence across the probabilities.

P: 0.60
not_P: 0.40
para_P: 0.60
Q: 0.30
P_and_Q: 0.18
P_or_Q: 0.72
Q_and_not_P: 0.12
Q_given_P: 0.50

neg: P = 1 - not_P, 0.60 = 1 - 0.40 is TRUE

and: max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), max(0.60 + 0.30 - 1, 0) <= 0.18 <= min(0.60, 0.30) is FALSE
or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.60, 0.30) <= 0.72 <= min(1, 0.60 + 0.30) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.60 = 0.72 - 0.12 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.60 ≈ 0.18 / 0.50 is TRUE
para: P = para_P, 0.60 = 0.60 is TRUE

Q.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

**P (Trump Family Nominee)**: I estimate a moderate probability that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, considering Donald Trump's significant influence within the party and the potential candidacies of his children. Given the current political landscape, I estimate this probability at 0.60.

**not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: Since this is the complement of P, it would be calculated as 1 - P. Therefore, not_P would be 0.40.

**para_P (Possible Trump Family Nominee)**: This question is similar to P, and since it asks if it's possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination, it should have a similar estimate. I will keep it at 0.60 as well.

**Q (China Conflict)**: The probability of armed conflicts between the US and China leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050 is more uncertain. Given current geopolitical tensions but the lack of direct conflict, I estimate this probability at 0.30.

**P_and_Q (Both Events Occur)**: This probability is the joint probability of both events occurring. Given the estimates of P and Q, I would calculate this using the assumption of independence: P_and_Q = P * Q = 0.60 * 0.30 = 0.18.

**P_or_Q (Either Event Occurs)**: This is calculated as P + Q - P_and_Q. Thus, P_or_Q = 0.60 + 0.30 - 0.18 = 0.72.

**Q_and_not_P (Conflict with No Trump Nominee)**: This would require both Q to occur and not_P to be true. I estimate this at a lower probability, say 0.10, since if there is significant conflict, it may not necessarily correlate with the Trump family not being nominated.

**Q_given_P (Conflict Given Trump Nominee)**: This conditional probability considers the likelihood of conflict if a Trump family member is the nominee. Given the historical context of Trump's presidency and foreign policy decisions, I estimate this at 0.40.

Now, I will check the consistency of these estimates with the given rules.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

**Q (Armed conflict leading to 100 deaths)**: The likelihood of armed conflicts escalating to this level is difficult to predict, but given historical tensions, I would assign a lower probability here, factoring in diplomatic relations and potential resolutions.

**P_and_Q (Both events occurring)**: This probability should be lower than either P or Q individually, as it requires both conditions to be true simultaneously.

**P_or_Q (Either event occurring)**: This should be higher than both P and Q, as it represents the combined likelihood of at least one of them happening.

**Q_and_not_P (Conflict leading to 100 deaths with no Trump nominee)**: This probability should reflect a scenario where the conflict occurs while the Trump family does not secure the nomination, likely lower than Q alone.

**Q_given_P (Conflict given Trump nominee)**: This conditional probability should reflect the likelihood of conflict occurring if a Trump family member is the nominee, which may be influenced by the political climate at that time.

In summary, the interdependencies between these events will guide the probability estimates, ensuring they adhere to the consistency rules. Each probability must be adjusted based on the relationships outlined in the questions, ensuring that complementary and conditional probabilities are correctly represented.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P.title: Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

**P**: The probability that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 is influenced by the current political climate, Trump's popularity within the party, and the potential for other candidates to emerge. Given the prominence of the Trump family and their established political connections, I estimate this probability to be relatively high. 

**not_P**: Conversely, the probability that no member of the Trump family will be the nominee must be complementary to P. If P is estimated at 0.65, then not_P would be 0.35. This reflects the uncertainty surrounding the nomination process, as new candidates could emerge or the political landscape could shift. 

**para_P**: This question is similar to P but framed as a possibility rather than a certainty. Given the high probability of a Trump family member being a nominee, I would estimate this probability to be slightly higher than P, reflecting the potential for various outcomes. 

**Q**: The probability of armed conflicts between the US and China leading to at least 100 deaths is a complex estimation that depends on geopolitical tensions and military engagements. Given the current state of affairs, I would estimate this probability to be moderate, considering the potential for conflicts but also the diplomatic efforts to avoid escalation. 

**P_and_Q**: This question combines both scenarios, requiring both events to occur. The probability of this happening would be lower than either P or Q alone, as it requires the intersection of both probabilities. 

**P_or_Q**: This question asks for either event to occur, which would increase the probability compared to P_and_Q. The estimate should reflect the likelihood of at least one of the scenarios happening. 

**Q_and_not_P**: This scenario requires Q to be true while P is false, which is a more specific and potentially lower probability event, as it relies on the occurrence of armed conflict while excluding the possibility of a Trump family member being the nominee. 

**Q_given_P**: This conditional question asks about the likelihood of Q occurring if P is true. Given that the nomination of a Trump family member might influence geopolitical decisions, this probability could be higher than Q alone, depending on the implications of their nomination on US-China relations. 

Overall, the interdependencies among these questions are crucial. For instance, if a Trump family member is nominated, it could affect the likelihood of Q, and vice versa. Thus, careful consideration of these relationships is essential in estimating the probabilities.

Q.title: Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, or (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
